issues.message: Consider shortening this phrase to just ‘whether’, unless you mean ‘regardless of whether’.
issues.context: ... skills to negotiate a creative future, whether or not they continue to study Art and Design. ...
issues.highlighted_context: ... skills to negotiate a creative future, whether or not they continue to study Art and Design. ...

issues.message: Use a comma before ‘or’ if it connects two independent clauses (unless they are closely connected and short).
issues.context: ...niques that they are knowledgeable about or they might be delivered by outside agen...

issues.message: This phrase is redundant. Consider using “outside”.
issues.context: ...ers' work. Many learners have interests outside of the classroom into which they can be im...

issues.message: Use a comma before ‘and’ if it connects two independent clauses (unless they are closely connected and short).
issues.context: ...ey can be immersed for their Unit 1 work and it might be in the skill of the teacher...
